qas.question: When is the Tucson Folk Festival held?

answers.text: the first Saturday and Sunday of May

qas.question: Where is the Tucson Folk Festival held?
How many performers are in the Tucson Folk Festival?
How much does the Tucson Folk Festival cost to get in?
Who runs the Tucson Folk Festival?

context: For the past 25 years, the Tucson Folk Festival has taken place <a0_0>the first Saturday and Sunday of May<a0_0/> in downtown Tucson's <a1_0>El Presidio Park<a1_0/>. In addition to nationally known headline acts each evening, the Festival highlights <a2_0>over 100<a2_0/> local and regional musicians on five stages is one of the largest <a3_0>free<a3_0/> festivals in the country. All stages are within easy walking distance. Organized by the <a4_0>Tucson Kitchen Musicians Association<a4_0/>, volunteers make this festival possible. KXCI 91.3-FM, Arizona's only community radio station, is a major partner, broadcasting from the Plaza Stage throughout the weekend. In addition, there are numerous workshops, events for children, sing-alongs, and a popular singer/songwriter contest. Musicians typically play 30-minute sets, supported by professional audio staff volunteers. A variety of food and crafts are available at the festival, as well as local micro-brews. All proceeds from sales go to fund future festivals.
